titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith, in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 June 7

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith, in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 June 7

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Will write you a few lines this afternoon even if I am so busy. I have had enough inspections for the last three days to get ten men out of the army. I am glad to say I have about finished them here though. We are expecting to leave here tomorow for Brest I guess we will have some more 2. Lieut. to deal with when we get there. But the worst of it is over and I am not at all sorry
I dont know just how long we will be at Brest I dont think will be long I am going to try to get home by the 4th of July If we dont have to stay in Brest to long I think well make it OK

Now if I do get there by that time you will have to take me out and show me the sights for I am sure I wont know how to act I wont try to tell you much about this place until I get home But will say it is an awful place, ask Lynn

We thought we were going to leave here to day but something happened I dont know what. We'll quit for this time will write you from Brest if we stay there very long. If not we'll let you know when I get in the U. S. Hopeing to see you real soon with lots of love.
